intro: Jupunba barbouriana, commonly known as the Barbour's jupunba, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has finely divided, fern-like leaves. It produces small white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
